meanings.definition: A special right, advantage, or immunity granted or available only to a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: Having the privilege to skip the line made the child very happy.
meanings.sent2: It is a privilege to have access to the exclusive club.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt privileged to have the comfiest spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: She wore her privilege like a crown, shining brightly among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The privilege of choosing the movie for movie night was eagerly anticipated.

meanings.definition: The right or benefit of enjoying a particular thing or activity.
meanings.sent1: Eating ice cream for breakfast was a rare privilege for the kids.
meanings.sent2: The privilege of playing in the park brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent3: The dog thought it was a privilege to chase squirrels all day.
meanings.sent4: The privilege of swimming in the ocean felt like freedom to her.
meanings.sent5: He cherished the privilege of staying up late on weekends.
